problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the arc length of the ABC sector is 15.42 and the area of the BCD right triangle is 93, compute the degree of the CBA angle. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (7669.03, -2631.98)
B = (34.23, 34.23)
C = (34.23, 8121.189999999999)
D = (-22965.77, 34.23)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(12, 6))

# Adjust axis limits for better presentation
ax.set_xlim(-24965.77, 10034.23)
ax.set_ylim(-4965.77, 15034.23)

# Draw the magenta arc
radius = 8121.189999999999
start_angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(A[1] - B[1], A[0] - B[0]))
end_angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(C[1] - B[1], C[0] - B[0]))

if start_angle > end_angle:
    end_angle += 360

arc = patches.Wedge(
    center=B,
    r=radius,
    theta1=start_angle,
    theta2=end_angle,
    facecolor="magenta",
    edgecolor="black",
    alpha=0.6
)
ax.add_patch(arc)

# Draw the gray triangle (B, C, D)
gray_triangle = patches.Polygon([B, C, D], closed=True, color="gray", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(gray_triangle)

# Draw right-angle marker
def draw_right_angle(ax, p1, p2, p3, size=1.0, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draw a right-angle marker at the corner defined by p1, p2, and p3.'''
    v1 = np.array(p1) - np.array(p2)
    v2 = np.array(p3) - np.array(p2)
    v1 = v1 / np.linalg.norm(v1) * size
    v2 = v2 / np.linalg.norm(v2) * size
    marker = patches.Polygon(
        [p2, p2 + v1, p2 + v1 + v2, p2 + v2],
        closed=True,
        facecolor=color,
        edgecolor=None,
        alpha=alpha
    )
    ax.add_patch(marker)

# Add right-angle marker
draw_right_angle(ax, C, B, D)

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="top")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")

# -- LENGTH ANNOTATION -- #
ax.text((B[0] + D[0]) / 2, (B[1] + D[1]) / 2, "23", fontsize=16, ha="center", va="bottom")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The length of the BD side in the BCD triangle is 23 and the area is 93 so the length of the BC side $= \frac{93 * 2}{23} = \frac{186}{23} = 8.09$. The BC radius of the ABC sector is 8.09 and the arc length is 15.42. So the CBA angle can be computed as $\frac{ArcLength}{2 \pi r} * 360 = \frac{15.42}{2 \pi * 8.09} * 360 = \frac{15.42}{50.81} * 360 = 0.3 * 360 = 108$. Therefore the final answer is 108.
